ratings.comment: Was looking forward to this course because of the folklore aspect, but there was none of it :( Prof is an odd dude who has knowledge but not in teaching. 100 level course and wanted to give us a 20 page paper assignment? Way too much work for very little points. Attendance is huge part of your grade so don't miss any classes! His TAs sucked too lol
Projects are pointless and take forever to complete. Attendance is required. Class is dumb, lots of way easier classes if you need a humanities credit.

Super nice, interesting guy with a passion for what he does. Course content is well covered, great job preparing you for the final exam. Main issue it is too time consuming with the projects. Unless the subject is a major passion of yours, I'd look elsewhere due to there being too many credit hours but if the area is a major interest I'd recommend.

Professor Gibson clearly has great knowledge of music, and he was refreshing to listen to during lecture because of the positive atmosphere that he created. The final and the final project were not the easiest, but if you put even minimal work in during the semester you should have the materials that you need to succeed.

Professor Gibson is a wonderful professor and you can really tell his passion for music from his instruction of the class. He is willing to work for the good of the students and has a really cute dog :) The final project was certainly a lot of work, however you get to pick your topic and you will be fine

I liked professor Gibson because he made a special accommodation for me. In that respect he is really caring about his students. I liked the assignments and although they were long, I enjoyed them because I liked music and have a slight background in it. If you really don't like music, don't take this class for an easy A.
Do you want to spend 20 hours working on a project that is only 10% of your grade? Didn't think so. Don't take this class.

Prof Gibson was an incredibly nice guy. However, this class is very project based and requires a lot time out of class to complete. I would probably not take this class again, but if you have questions Prof Gibson will answer them well. Overall, if you take this course with him know that there is a lot of time and planning you need to have.
I loved Music 103! Professor Gibson was a thoughtful and informative lecturer, and the course was interesting and challenging. I loved the project work, although it was time-intensive.

Lectures were very rushed, disorganized, and didn't further understanding of the content, despite having mandatory attendance. Homework was time-consuming. No content was posted ahead of time, making it hard to work ahead. Textbook readings were extremely long. Do not take this class unless absolutely necessary. Worst class I have ever taken.

This was the worst class I have ever taken. The textbook chapters are incredibly dense, and the associated lectures don't facilitate further understanding. Prof Gibson refuses to post his lecture slides which is ridiculous. Aspects of the final project were not revealed until mid semester, making it hard to plan and build a cohesive narrative.
